paper_abstract: Unlike monotone single-valued functions, multivalued mappings may have zero, one, or (possibly infinitely) many minimal fixed-points. The contribution of this work is twofold. First, we overview and investigate the existence and computation of minimal fixed-points of multivalued mappings, whose domain is a complete lattice and whose range is its power set. Second, we show how these results are applied to a general form of logic programs, where the truth space is a complete lattice. We show that a multivalued operator can be defined whose fixed-points are in one-to-one correspondence with the models of the logic program.
paper_title: ON FIXED-POINTS OF MULTIVALUED FUNCTIONS ON COMPLETE LATTICES AND THEIR APPLICATION TO GENERALIZED LOGIC PROGRAMS
